definitions.example: He was always known for his grace, kindness, and courtesy to people of every rank.

definitions.definition: A polite gesture or remark, especially as opposed to an obligation or standard practice.
definitions.example: I offered them a ride simply as a courtesy.

definitions.definition: Consent or agreement in spite of fact; indulgence.
definitions.example: They call this pond a lake by courtesy only.

definitions.definition: Willingness or generosity in providing something needed.
definitions.example: They received free advertising through the courtesy of the local newspaper.

definitions.definition: The life interest that the surviving husband has in the real or heritable estate of his wife.
Given or done as a polite gesture.
definitions.example: We paid a courtesy visit to the new neighbors.
The event planners offered courtesy tickets for the reporters.
The hotel's staff variously curtsied, nodded, and bowed to the owner as she passed.
